repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: The collection consists of materials from Theodore Day's service in the New York State Assembly and New York State Senate in the 1960s and early 1970s.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: Theodore Day was born on April 20, 1917 and was from Interlaken, New York. He attended Yale University. Day was a member of the New York State Assembly from Seneca County from 1961 through 1965. He also was a member of the New York State Senate from 1966 to 1972. Day was appointed the Assistant New York State Commissioner of Agriculture and Markets in 1972.
Day died on December 22, 2003, at the Cayuga Medical center in Ithaca New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of materials from Theodore Day's service in the New York State Assembly and New York State Senate in the 1960s and early 1970s. It includes correspondence, bills, reports, subject files, research, clippings, and press releases.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Theodore Day initially donated his papers to Syracuse University in a series of eight accessions in 1970. In 2006, the papers were transferred to the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted because it is unprocessed. Portions of the collection may contain recent administrative records and/or personally identifiable information. While it is likely that portions of the collection may be viewed, access must be managed by an archivist.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of copyright. Whenever possible, the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives will provide information about copyright owners and other restrictions, but the legal determination ultimately rests with the researcher. Requests for permission to publish material from this collection should be discussed with the Head of Special Collections and Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Theodore Day Papers, 1961-1972. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Day Papers).
